posts.post_content:
Since [Koth of the Hammer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Koth of the Hammer) got printed Chandra has actually become much better for mono red control variants. When you drop a Koth *then* drop a Chandra (even better is drop a Karn in there somewhere too) it becomes much harder for your opponent to evaluate which PW to swing at. If Koth goes ultimate it's GG, if Chandra goes ultimate you wipe his board.  
  
Not to mention a resolved Chandra = 6dmg to a creature for 5 mana, that is quite good. Also both Koth and Chandra can ultimate the turn after they are dropped with just a single instance of Proliferate.
posts.html:

When you drop a Koth then drop a Chandra (even better is drop a Karn in there somewhere too) it becomes much harder for your opponent to evaluate which PW to swing at. If Koth goes ultimate it's GG, if Chandra goes ultimate you wipe his board.

Not to mention a resolved Chandra = 6dmg to a creature for 5 mana, that is quite good. Also both Koth and Chandra can ultimate the turn after they are dropped with just a single instance of Proliferate.

posts.post_content:
It's odd how my prediction that Chandra would fall out of play due to combust was wildly incorrect. I thought combust would make her obsolete for killing baneslayers, but actually the titans scared baneslayer away, so now the creatures to kill are stuff combust can't smash while Chandra barely gets them. Still, you're paying 5 mana for it.  
  
Chandra's biggest issue is that once your opponent does 1-2 points of damage to her, she's not threatening anyone with her ultimate (it'll take too long to build her up to 8 at that point), which means it's pointless to use her horrible +1, so then you're stuck with a -X that will kill herself quickly. Compared to other planeswalkers, like elspeth or gideon or jace 2.0 or ajani vengeant, who have very solid +1 or 0 abilities, which means they're a threat even if they're at 1-2 loyalty.  
  
She's not BAD, but if I'm not mistaken, at the highest level of play (e.g. where all the pricey cards like jaces are flown around the place) the only time she pops u... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: mdakw576 (4/27/2012 2:52:18 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
If it weren't for other planeswalkers out there, she'd look better.  
  
At the least, 5 mana nets 6 damage to a target creature. At best that's 2 mana more efficient than fireball, but it lacks the scaling. Still, if the full 6 isn't needed she starts growing and eventually the opponent has to deal with her, which means damage not coming to you. If her ultimate can come into play, it is a game changer.  
  
Still, would be nice to have a little extra. Maybe 1 less mana cost or her -X damage could target other planeswalkers (her +1 can). Relative to other planeswalkers, 2 damage from her +1 doesn't seem overpowered -- Koth's mountains hit for 4 and Chandra costs 1 more. Gideon Jura effectively has no ultimate but can swing for 6.  
  
Then again, maybe it's all the other planeswalkers are just better than they should be.
posts.html:

Still, if the full 6 isn't needed she starts growing and eventually the opponent has to deal with her, which means damage not coming to you. If her ultimate can come into play, it is a game changer.

Still, would be nice to have a little extra. Maybe 1 less mana cost or her -X damage could target other planeswalkers (her +1 can). Relative to other planeswalkers, 2 damage from her +1 doesn't seem overpowered -- Koth's mountains hit for 4 and Chandra costs 1 more. Gideon Jura effectively has no ultimate but can swing for 6.

Then again, maybe it's all the other planeswalkers are just better than they should be.

posts.post_content: hi, people who think she sucks, u obviously cant play red at all, i have ended everyone anytime i got her on the field and people tend to want to scoop when she hits the field. the -1 is meant to be a time pass while you slam the opponent with other stuff. u spent 5 to play her, next turn, that 5, perhaps 6 if u get another land, can be used for some lightning bolts or shocks or a well-aimed arc trail, the -X is a defense against monsters and banks on the hopes that you have a iota of skill to get her counters up again, if u play a planeswalker, you gain an ally, that's why they are called loyalty counters, but they also expect loyalty from you, those of you play them to simply throw them away after their ultimates resolve make me sick, as speaking of ultimates, it takes four turns to use it and keep her around, not that much with a proper red offense-defense tactic deck like it should be, and planeswalkers are weighed in costed by their first two abilities, the ultimate is a bonus, so...
